I am the sea captain navigating the treacherous waters of illegal shark finning.

Look, these bleeding hearts who whine about the sharks don't understand a thing about making a living. They sit in their ivory towers, sipping their lattes, while I'm out here risking my neck to put food on the table.  

Sure, I've had to smooth-talk a few buyers, convince them that the profits are worth it.  You gotta play to their greed.  Show them the numbers, the demand, the kind of money they can make.  They'll forget about the "ethics" pretty quick when they see dollar signs.

And partners? They're easy.  Most of them are in it for the same reason I am - to make a buck. As long as the money's good, they'll turn a blind eye to anything.  It's a business, plain and simple. 

You think I enjoy this?  No. But it's what I gotta do.  It's survival. And frankly, those sharks are just fish.  Plenty more where they came from.
